page.title: 07Overton Farm, Sway.
page.content: This farm covers 130 acres of quality grazing land near the New Forest. Mr Charles Lance started farming at Overton in 1939. His two sons now farm the land though Mr Lance continues to take an active interest. Overton is a dairy farm with a prize winning herd of{Guernseys,}including 101 cows, 70 heifers and 3 bulls. One of the bulls is currently at the New Forest Cattle Breeder Association's headquarters at Lyndhurst. The herd produces one of the highest dairy yields in the country. One cow, Lancewood Delia 10th holds the national record for the highest buttermilk and milk yield. The cows are milked in a modern, fully tiled, computer controlled herringbone milking parlour. This milk is collected daily by a baulk tanker and taken to Edgar's Dairy in New Milton.
